data.text:
CategoriesObject typeTitleThe Blue LampMaterials and techniques

Colour lithograph

Brief description

'The Blue Lamp'; Poster advertising the film directed by Basil Dearden, produced by Ealing Studios; Colour lithograph; Signed; Design by James Boswell; Great Britain; 1949.

Physical description

'The Blue Lamp'; Poster advertising the film directed by Basil Dearden, starring Jack Warner, Jimmy Hanley, Dirk Bogarde and Robert Fleming, produced by Ealing Studios; Colour lithograph; Signed.

Dimensions

Height: 55.8cm

Width: 71cm

Dimensions taken from: Summary Catalogue of British Posters to 1988 in the Victoria & Albert Museum in the Department of Design, Prints & Drawing. Emmett Publishing, 1990. 129 p. ISBN: 1 869934 12 1Marks and inscriptions

Signed.

Credit line

Given by Ruth Boswell

Object history

This film spawned the classic BBC television series 'Dixon of Dock Green' about a typical 'bobby' (policeman) on the beat. The painting was part of Boswell's Camden Town series but the setting of the film is Paddington Green.

Subject depictedBibliographic reference

Summary Catalogue of British Posters to 1988 in the Victoria & Albert Museum in the Department of Design, Prints & Drawing. Emmett Publishing, 1990. 129 p. ISBN: 1 869934 12 1

Other number

4/F6 - V&A microfiche

Collection
